trans-unit.source: For Windows 8, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) uses the [Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) for creating test content.
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8, the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) uses the [Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439725) for creating test content.

trans-unit.source: A TAEF test is an object implemented as a dynamic-link library (DLL) that contains multiple methods, where each method maps to a specific test scenario.
trans-unit.target: A TAEF test is an object implemented as a dynamic-link library (DLL) that contains multiple methods, where each method maps to a specific test scenario.

trans-unit.source: The TAEF object combines related methods into a group of tests.
trans-unit.target: The TAEF object combines related methods into a group of tests.

trans-unit.source: For each test, there is a set of metadata that describes the test.
trans-unit.target: For each test, there is a set of metadata that describes the test.

trans-unit.source: To improve test portability and encapsulation, TAEF stores test metadata within the test object itself.
trans-unit.target: To improve test portability and encapsulation, TAEF stores test metadata within the test object itself.

trans-unit.source: When you create your own driver tests using the Driver Test templates, you need to add this metadata so that your driver tests are available and can be deployed using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: When you create your own driver tests using the Driver Test templates, you need to add this metadata so that your driver tests are available and can be deployed using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: The source code for a driver test written by using one of the Driver Test templates.
trans-unit.target: The source code for a driver test written by using one of the Driver Test templates.

trans-unit.source: For information, see [How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template](how_to_write_a_driver_test_.md).
trans-unit.target: For information, see [How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template](how_to_write_a_driver_test_.md).

trans-unit.source: Add the required test property metadata to the source files for your test.
trans-unit.target: Add the required test property metadata to the source files for your test.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you use the Driver Test template to create your version of the SurpriseRemove test, the following metadata is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you use the Driver Test template to create your version of the SurpriseRemove test, the following metadata is added.

trans-unit.source: Edit the test description, display name, category, and results file attributes.
trans-unit.target: Edit the test description, display name, category, and results file attributes.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the test property attributes.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the test property attributes.

trans-unit.source: Use the examples for guidance as you edit or add the metadata for your tests.
trans-unit.target: Use the examples for guidance as you edit or add the metadata for your tests.

trans-unit.source: A short description of what the test does.
trans-unit.target: A short description of what the test does.

trans-unit.source: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Description", L"Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template")
trans-unit.target: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Description", L"Plug and Play Surprise Remove Generated Template")

trans-unit.source: The name of the test as it shown in Driver Test.
trans-unit.target: The name of the test as it shown in Driver Test.

trans-unit.source: TestProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="Sleep with IO Before and After
trans-unit.target: TestProperty name="Kits.DisplayName" value="Sleep with IO Before and After

trans-unit.source: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.DisplayName", L"My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test")
trans-unit.target: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.DisplayName", L"My Plug and Play Surprise Remove Test")

trans-unit.source: A standard parameter for a method call.
trans-unit.target: A standard parameter for a method call.

trans-unit.source: A test can have multiple parameters.
trans-unit.target: A test can have multiple parameters.

trans-unit.source: TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Description" value="Test mode parameter: Logo or Simple
trans-unit.target: TestProperty name="Kits.Parameter.TM.Description" value="Test mode parameter: Logo or Simple

trans-unit.source: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description", L"A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s)")
trans-unit.target: TEST_METHOD_PROPERTY(L"Kits.Parameter.DQ.Description", L"A WDTF SDEL query that is used to identify the target device(s)")

trans-unit.source: The default value for the parameter.
trans-unit.target: The default value for the parameter.

trans-unit.source: This attribute marks the test for inclusion in the WDK.
trans-unit.target: This attribute marks the test for inclusion in the WDK.

trans-unit.source: Describes the category of a test.
trans-unit.target: Describes the category of a test.

trans-unit.source: Identifies files and/or folders as test dependencies.
trans-unit.target: Identifies files and/or folders as test dependencies.

trans-unit.source: These may contain any resources needed to run the tests.
trans-unit.target: These may contain any resources needed to run the tests.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using this metadata, see [DeploymentItem Metadata](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439604).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using this metadata, see [DeploymentItem Metadata](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Hh439604).

trans-unit.source: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template
trans-unit.target: How to write a driver test using a Driver Test template
